Not as shown.

It's in a great area - easily walk-able to many restaurants, subway stops, Fort Green Park etc. 
If you're planning a short stay and plan to be out a lot it's a great find - there are 3 young children in the house below and sound travels up so if you're looking to work or rest/read probably not the best. Lisa was nice and accommodating.

LisaRoxanne got back to me with answers to my questions right away and was very accommodating. The place was very comfortable and she had the AC turned on for us before we got there which was great :) I would definitely recommend this spot and stay again someday.

I have encountered many efficient and considerate hosts via Airbnb, but none of them come close to LisaRoxanne. Not only was she incredibly understanding when I had to change my original reservation, when a family emergency forced me to leave her place only hours after my arrival, she refunded half my money purely out of her own generosity. I had not remotely expected her to do this and so was not only very grateful to her for her kindness, but also deeply touched. But even before I had arrived at her clean, comfortable and sunlit apartment, LisaRoxanne had responded rapidly and efficiently to my every question or request and had been completely straightforward, considerate and understanding. She was there waiting for me when I arrived, and her apartment's eat-in kitchen turned out to be larger than I expected, with a view out onto sunlit treetops, which was both beautiful and felt private. I will also add that LisaRoxanne has a subtle but spot-on sense of humor and that there is a feature in her apartment that will be much appreciated by any pandemic-weary visitor.

Re: any critical reviews on this place -- read the listing! I feel that the description is accurate. While you can hear people downstairs and the stairs lead directly up to your third floor, no one is walking through your space and your bedroom door does shut. For the price I would say this is a good find, good neighborhood! Would not bring a finicky neatfreak to stay here but for a quick stopover it suited our needs well. Family was pleasant. :)
Wonderful and courteous. Perfect location. Safe area. Suitable for couples or a family with small children. All around great host.

I felt like I was in the heart of Brooklyn, the house is right near a nice local garden. Bus stop is right on her block and the A&C train is about a 10 minute walk. The food places in the Bedford are spread out so just rent a bike and you're good honestly. Inside was cozy as well.

We made our reservation last minute and also had to change our checkout day during our stay, but she took care of it all quickly for us. It seems like it would be a good place for a long stay, with a homely atmosphere. I hope we have the chance to stay again. Thank you!
Clean, convenient. Communication could be better.
We had a nice stay, everything was good.
Great communication. Convenient location. Very hospitable.
This spot was exactly as expected and Lisa was friendly host.
it is  very simple , modest ,private  apartment on the 3 rd floor  in an  well paced neighborhood. With nice Restaurants  & bars.  the host was very accommodating & responded quickly.
LisaRoxanne’s space is great. It’s super functional and the a/c in the bedroom is a godsend.
Host was very flexible with our check in and check out times. She responded quickly as well! Exactly what we needed for two nights in Brooklyn.
The space was much smaller than expected. Couldn’t leave bedroom door open or it’ll get warm very fast.
nice location closed to Brooklin bridge  , easy access .
Lisa is an amazing host and her family is great too. The location was gorgeous and there’s plenty to eat around the air bnb.

LisaRoxanne is very friendly and quick to respond, the place you can tell is thoroughly cleaned and overall was great for my needs! Thank you LisaRoxanne.
Nice, unique space with plenty of light and room. LisaRoxanne was also an amazing host!

As advertised!  I had a most relaxing and enjoyable stay at LisaRoxanne's place and would most assuredly return.   Everything was easily navigated, a parking spot across the street and most hospitable responses to my needs around arrival time and entrance.  The speed of response to my request to book was also appreciated.
The place was simple and great. It reminded us a lot of our apartment in Brooklyn, which we missed. The location is prime near a ton of great places to eat.
Great location, clean and comfortable. Hostess was friendly and helpful.

This is definitely a great bang for your buck! It’s the entire third floor of the host’s home, but the stairwell is separated so there is plenty of privacy. We only interacted with the (very helpful!) host over AirB&B, we never bumped into each other in the home. I really appreciated this, especially with Covid protocol. 

If you’re looking for a place to crash while you’re out enjoying the city, I’d definitely recommend!

LisaRoxanne is a wonderful host! Her place is a classic Brooklyn Brownstone with a lot of character. You have to walk up the stairs through the house to get to the top floor, but once you’re there it’s a haven. She takes care of little details that make you feel special (extra tooth brush, tooth Paste, shower supplies, and it does feel very clean, albeit it is an older building. 

Overall I had a great experience and her and her family are super sweet.

It was a nice space, only a 10 min walk from the subway station to get around NY as well as bus stops right near by to get around Brooklyn. 

Towels and toothbrushes were provided which was extra nice. My friend and I were there for 2 nights so we were out most of the time but there was also a kitchen and dining area on our floor (3rd) where we could’ve cooked if we wanted.

Awesome host. This is the most comfortable I have felt in an AirBnB. It was clean to my liking and the temperature was comfortable. The host was responsive, relatable, and so understanding. I would absolutely stay here again.

LisaRoxanne's place is just as described and shown in the pictures. Great location and easy to find free street parking. She was good at communicating and very accommodating. I highly recommend her place. I will stay here again next time I plan a trip to New York.
Lisa Roxanne was easy to communicate with and the apartment was very nice and private.

It's a separate floor of a multi floor family apt. You will hear the family. I needed a clean crash pad to visit family and it was what I needed. You get what you pay for - a socially distanced floor, in a great location, for a good price.
Kind host, good location, good value

LisaRoxanne is a very kind host and person. The first thing you notice is that the place is very clean. This rental is a wonderful find, and a great value for the money. The bedroom has lots of space, as does the kitchen. 

The bed is super comfortable. We slept well. We loved the hardwood floors and beautiful old victorian banister and steps. The third floor is broken up into half at the top of the stairs. On one side is the kitchen and bathroom, the other side is the bedroom. I would pay more for the space if the bedroom was styled a little bit. It is basic, has everything you could need. The kitchen has a nice style to it, and both areas are very clean.

I really wish I could have given a full 5 stars, but the host didn't respond until after I called customer service. (The check in instructions say to confirm where the key will be ahead of time.) It normally wouldn't have been as big of deal to me if I had to wait in the rain a little. However, because I was on crutches it would have been a problem. I needed to know before I arrived that I could get in. 

It all worked out great in the end though. I highly recommend LisaRoxanne's place! And would stay her again.
Great spot for an overnight in Brooklyn

LisaRoxanne was a great host! She was quick with responses and was very flexible with our check in time. She was also very thoughtful and offered us her parking spot when I informed her we were struggling to find parking on the street!
Great location and lovely neighborhood, super flexible and kind host, great windows views and nice to have a private kitchen and bathroom!

LisaRoxanne’s place was great. We had the entire too floor to ourselves. LisaRoxanne was nice, helpful, and generally inviting while the place had all the amenities needed to make your stay excellent. The apartment was very close to anything and everything you need. Bus stop, metro stop, local coffee shop, local eateries, playgrounds, grocery stores, etc. the location was perfect. I will definitely stay there again when heading back to Brooklyn.

Lisa is a wonderful person. She is communicative. Lisa provides everything like 5-star hotels. Free parking in the area, but it is difficult to get a parking due to the crowding. Close to Classon station, five minute walk. There is a small grocery store next to the house with a bus stop. A great place to stay and I recommend it.
Awesome stay, would return! Great location and very clean. Thank you so much!

Great place, great service, and solid location! You will be staying on the third floor of her house, as opposed it being its own apartment. So you get privacy however, it just might not be what you'd expect. Overall, I would absolutely stay here again.
Excellent location in one of my favorite neighborhoods in New York. Very clean and private space. LisaRoxanne was an excellent and very accommodating host.
Lisa's place is very similar to her pictures. It was a great stay and great location. She's there to answer any questions and the space truly does feel private even with the shared staircase.

LisaRoxanne’s space offers all the basics you need, including a well equipped kitchen with a large refrigerator.  Unfortunately, it wasn’t as private as I needed. LisaRoxanne makes a point of saying the apartment is on the top floor of her home, but I had imagined it differently than what it was. Before arriving, I was picturing a space that was enclosed behind a door at the top of the stairs. But the kitchen area opens directly to the staircase and the stairs run through the center of the family home. My work requires confidentiality, so I realized once I got there that it wouldn’t work for me to conduct teletherapy at the dining table. LisaRoxanne was very understanding and allowed me to check out early. I never saw her face to face, which is good with the pandemic, but she was very responsive over text. The other residents were very quiet while I was there. If you don’t need total privacy and want a crash pad where you can cook and read, this is a great value.

Lisa was super kind and helpful whenever we needed something; she even helped us to get a reservation for our Covid test in a medical center (required for our flight).
We were three people staying there and the space was more than enough and comfortable. The kitchen was nicely equipped and we used it a lot.

8 minute walk to a subway station (which we used a lot) and 5 minute walk to supermarkets.

Shunichi was an excellent host. He stayed up late to meet me on the 
night that I arrived and he responded promptly by text to the few
questions I had during my stay. The room had not only a bed and desk,
but also its own refrigerator and microwave. The location was very
convenient and the price reasonable. I would definitely stay with
Shunichi again if I visit Midtown Manhattan.
A simple and peaceful retreat after a long day in the city. Much appreciated the unintrusive hospitality.

Great location, great price, and has all you need for a place to come back to at the end of the night after a day of exploring. The room & bathroom could use some cleaning, but the bed itself was clean and for my stay that’s all I really needed.
Not fancy, but functional, and a great location.

This place is located in a convenient midtown location, near transportation. It’s near a busy avenue so can be loud at times. The room was comfortable and had everything I needed.

The house is at a perfect location in park slope, one of the best neighbourhoods of brooklyn. Lots of restaurants and bars nearby. Also the subway station is one block away. In 25 minutes in mid-town manhattan. The house has a nice atmosphere and  is very clean. Lots of suggestions by our host for activities to do in NY.

Laurie's package of info is a wealth of info. And, of course, so is she! Whatever you need or are seeking, she has suggestions to help make this happen. Convenient location with lots of space. Ideal place to explore Park Slope.

Laurie was so kind and offered my friend and me because of the Covid 19 situation the apartment (flat)  instead of the room we booked. The apartment is very cosy and furnished with love. The area Park Slope is full of nice shops and restaurants. The booklet Laurie send us was very useful. Thank you :)

My situation was unique in that I stayed in Laurie's beautiful old home during a quarantine in preparation for my son's wedding. I had the place mostly to myself, but the location and the space was perfect. It was quiet and close to plenty of food and wine needs. Her cats - Batman and Robin - kept me company and kept me from missing my own furry babies back home. I especially enjoyed the back garden on a cool afternoon. As quarantines go, it was pretty nice!
Great place to stay and great hospitality!
Beautiful home and great location. Laurie is super welcoming and helpful. Would absolutely stay again in a heartbeat!

Decent, not great. The bed was comfortable, but the mattress protector had a huge coffee-like stain on it and the bed skirt was dusty. The photos are enhanced to make this below-grade apartment seem brighter than it actually is. Minimal amenities; not even any coffee unless someone before you was generous enough to leave some behind. We were left with someone’s decaf and some old tea. You can hear outside noise, but that’s to be expected. What’s not expected was being able to hear everything from the hosts upstairs. VERY thin walls. We could hear them walking around, opening doors, coughing, etc. Also their bird. I don’t know what kind of bird it was, but it’s a loud screeching type, not a small chirping bird. It wasn’t very active until the morning we were checking out when it was squawking very loudly all morning long. The hosts were also stomping around upstairs, repeatedly going up and down the stairs outside the apt door, and opening/closing heavy doors all morning. I don’t know whether all of this activity was intentional, but since no other morning was that excessively noisy other than the one on check out day, it sure felt intentional and very rude. Maybe they have had other guests overstay past check out time, but that’s really no reason to punish future guests.

There are better deals with the new pod hotels that are cleaner and closer to where you want to be. We’ll be going that route next time.
Good apartment!!
Irina was a gracious host. The apartment is large for NYC. Great location!

Allen & Irina are great hosts. My partner and I stayed at this studio apartment for a week during a networking trip and it was perfect. Large private studio a few blocks from the subway, perfect for a weekend or long term stay! Would recommend to anyone going to NYC looking for a private place.

Allen and Irina's studio is quite lovely! Very well decorated and spacious enough to spread your things out and relax. Perfect for two guests. We loved the location -- very close to coffee shops, restaurants, bars and just a quick metro ride into the city! We did not stay long enough to utilize the kitchen, but it seems perfect for guests who want to cook during their stay!

There are a lot of noise, not only from the neighbourhood, but you can hear everything from the hosts who live upstairs. They have a bird or another animal that makes noises all day long and night. Additionally, every morning it sounded like someone was trying to break down the window in the kitchen - rather disturbing.
This is a lovely garden apartment in The Ft Greene neighborhood - great location for visiting Brooklyn and Manhattan.  Spacious and comfortable..    Jane was a super host...  I hope to go back soon.
She is so kind. The house is beautiful and retio~I love it
Second time booking with Jane. Great place. Great neighborhood. Comfortable bed, luxe linens, awesome shower! Sunny kitchenette with garden view.

This place is a gem! Quiet, comfortable, stylish, great location! 
Bed is comfortable, plenty of room to relax after dinner or sightseeing, and a great shower!! Jane was amazing  with her responses and accomodated our needs. We will definitely stay here again when back
In BK.
Just an excellent place to stay

Jane's place has a stunning garden just one block from Fort Greene park. She was very responsive and accommodating - including upgrading the wifi router when we were having connectivity issues. Checkin and checkout was seamless.
Great host. Place was spotless and the open concept throughout the house is amazing.  I would definitely stay again. Thanks again Jane
Beautifully decorated and a great location! Jane was very helpful and accommodating. Would definitely stay again!
Jane was a lovely host. The hospitality was outstanding and the home was sparkling clean. I would highly recommend staying here for a relaxing getaway.

I wanted a short stay for rest and relaxation, and this beautiful place was definitely it. Jane was very accommodating with my last minute booking. The place is absolutely beautiful, and the back yard is peaceful and serene.Great location, area very quiet. Will definitely stay again in the near future.
This place was fantastic! Very cute, comfortable, clean, loved the location. Would definitely stay again!
Just as advertised and a bit more, we would stay again, hopefully COVID is gone next time but great nonetheless!

I cannot even begin to say how lovely Jane and her home was. The place itself is beautiful, very ornate and the details of the place are amazing. The space was even larger than the pictures. It’s in a very nice location with an easy walk to several subway stations. Jane was such a kind host – the best I’ve ever personally had staying at an Airbnb. She helped us out-of-towners navigate the subway, parking, and was friendly and quick to respond to any questions or inquiries. We will definitely be back in the future!

Jane’s place is well-appointed and had everything we needed - a well-stocked kitchenette, comfortable beds, a clean bathroom with great water pressure, and lots of charm. It also has a fabulous outdoor space.

Check-in and checkout were easy, and Jane was very accommodating. She offered to make up the pullout couch for us before we arrived, which was helpful. 

The property is located on a picturesque, tree-lined street. We took a road trip to visit family and easily found street parking nearby. The location felt safe and although we didn’t go out much because of the pandemic, it’s within walking distance of lots of coffee shops, corner groceries, and restaurants. We visited beautiful Fort Greene Park a number of times, about a block away. There’s a great farmers market there on Saturdays.
Lovely comfortable apartment.  Beautiful  backyard and great location.  Jane is very accommodating and thoughtful.  We had a wonderful stay . Would cone back again
We’ve stayed here twice and will reserve again. Large rooms, large and comfortable bed. Lovely outdoor space. Convenient location close to the park.
This apartment was wonderful and I felt very confident that it was clean the moment I walked in. I would absolutely stay here again.
There is a lovely garden and a nice living room with a big tv hooked up to cable.  The wifi is good.  And the shower has great water pressure.  It is a very cute apartment in a lovely location.
Jane's place is fantastic.  Great location, perfectly clean, and comfortable.  Jane even left fresh flowers for us in the kitchen, much appreciated touch!

Jane was a great host. She was quick in communicating, flexible when our plans changed and very accommodating. The apartment was very clean and well kept. It is very well located just a block from Fort Green park and a short walk to restaurants and transit lines, yet is very quiet with very little street noise. There is a nice view on to the back garden.

Jane was an excellent host, quick and thoughtful communication, offered additional space if needed, very accommodating.  Excellent WiFi/internet, large TV w/cable, remodeled shower, seemingly isolated from street noise.  A very short walk to Forte Green park and local businesses.  A very nice outdoor garden space to view from inside or walk into. A great location.
Lots of light in the kitchen, huge comfy couch + ottoman. Quality wood floors and tile bathroom. I felt like I had a calm retreat in the middle of Ft. Greene.
Jane’s space is perfect for a special city stay. Jane herself is thoughtful, attentive, and kind. We’re grateful to her for letting us stay there twice now.
great place great host

It’s hard to describe just how beautiful this location is. If the huge, sunny backyard isn’t enough roaming ground for you, you’re just a few paces from Fort Greene park. There’s a real feeling of serenity and charm here.

We had a lovely stay at Jane's beautiful apartment and garden.  So spacious and comfortable (particularly the king size bed!). The garden is extraordinary with its magnolias in full bloom, tulips and daffodils and we loved experiencing life for a week on one of the prettiest neighborhoods in Brooklyn so close to our family.  Far superior to a hotel stay.  We highly recommend and will be back!

Jane’s place was great. Very spacious. Amazing outdoor space. Unique light filled kitchenette. High end bathroom. The neighborhood is full of restaurants and cafes. Very quiet and good internet. Jane is super easy to communicate with and a lovely host.
Great place and conveniently located for our needs.
We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at Janes. The location was ideal for us. The listing well represented the apartment and the back yard was a beautiful retreat. We intend to come back!
It is a charming, cozy space with lots of character. My sisters, niece and I enjoyed cooking together, snuggling up chatting and laughing in what felt like a sweet vacation cabin In country.

Natalie's place was stylish, eclectic and comfortable. The balcony and living rooms a were definitely our favorite. A big daybed full of pillows on the balcony was perfect for us to enjoy the cool night air and each other's company. There are many comfy places to lay your head and sage to clear the air and unwind. Great value for such a large space.

I’ve been to a lot of Airbnb’s in Brooklyn, but this is by far one of my favorites.  The place is clean and very very cozy.  If you sit down to watch tv you might just wind up napping.  The place is amazing, from decor to patio, to the way everything has been arranged.  Even the old style bathroom was cool.  If it wasn’t for Covid there’d be a lot of bars open nearby.  Still, a great experience if you want to stay in.

Nathalie’s home is an absolute dream in the heart of Bed- Stuy. Booking couldn’t have been a simpler process as Nathalie is extremely communicative and responded nearly immediately. Read the rules! Everything is very clear! No stress check in, arrive and use the lockbox whenever you’re ready. Once you open the door you’re going to fall in love and want to cancel any and all plans to go out (you’re also going to wake up on Sunday and immediately extend your reservation.. just trust me and book Sunday night as well.) The backyard space paired with a glass of wine and the essence of whatever vibe is happening on the block is prime entertainment in and of itself. You’re in the heart of Bed- Stuy with access to the train only a few blocks down giving you the accessibility to explore whatever part of town you’re in the mood for although you can find almost any vibe you’re looking for within a few blocks. Early mornings in Nathalie’s space was really prime time though, the natural light that streams through all the windows in the apartment was so beautiful to wake up to. As someone who’s been traveling to New York over the past few years, Nathalie’s home was genuinely everything I could’ve asked for. Do yourself a favour and experience it for yourself!!

Nathalie's home is lovely with really interesting decorations. She was also very responsive, even when I was having wifi trouble. (Thank you very much!) I'd recommend staying in Nathalie’s brownstone.

James's loft in East Williamsburg is an amazing space perfect for 2 people or 2 couples with a bedroom and a separate loft space. James is a photographer and his creative sense is well-represented in his thoughtful, stylish, quirky furnishings and decorations. Fun, artful, and beautiful details abound such as 

The dramatic photos should give you a sense of how much space there is! The loft features very high ceilings, around 12 feet, huge windows facing both east and west for incredible natural light in the morning and afternoon.

The common spaces include a kitchen, dining area, and living room with two couches, two leather armchairs, and a huge white backdrop that doubles as a projector wall for night time video watching with James's bright HD projector. As a note, we stayed in the heart of the New York's hot and humid summer and the loft does not have central air conditioning, so it gets hot inside. You can open the screened windows wide and there are two big portable fans to circulate the air. Given the age of the building, the size of the windows, it may also get chilly in the winter. There are built-in heaters in the bedroom and common area that we, summer visitors, understandably, never tried.

There is a well-appointed kitchen with a dining table for 6 diners, and a large commercial kitchen counter for prep work. We stayed for two weeks and cooked regularly using the pots, pans, gas stove, oven, microwave, and refrigerator. There is a drip coffee maker, but we used the French press for our caffeine needs.

The bedroom is completely enclosed and is the only space with air-conditioning. Since its a small window unit, it does cool the bedroom, but it isn't able to cool the rest of the space. The loft does have much less headroom, someone tall will need to duck to move around. There is plenty of space to hang your clothes, store them in dressers and shelves, store your luggage.

Under the loft is the office and the bathroom. The office features an old-fashioned office desk and chair, paired with decent 20Mb downstream Wifi connection. Ideal for working in the day, streaming videos at night.

The loft is on the 4th and top floor of an old industrial building which gives it much of its unique character, charm, and a dramatic view of its Brooklyn surroundings. However, there is no elevator and the floors are tall (enabling loft spaces) meaning you will have to carry all your luggage up and down 4 extra high floors. I am fit and was winded by the time I reached the fourth floor. If you not comfortable climbing stairs, this space may not be right for you.

We spent 9 weeks at Dimitri's place (late October through December 2020). We thoroughly enjoyed our stay! Dimitri himself could not be more gracious and helpful as host. He lives upstairs (3rd floor) and his family lives on 1st floor. They are all musicians but very respectful of quiet hours. The location, security and condition of this 2nd floor apartment is OUTSTANDING, especially for anyone staying in the Prospect Heights/Park Slope area. Easy walk to scenic outdoor areas like Prospect Park and the Botanic Garden (reservation-only during pandemic). In healthier times, there will be dozens of great restaurants, bars, stores and city parks nearby too. Check-in was seamless, with Dimitri willing to help however needed. If you have a car, the fireplug out front provides a great short-term unloading zone. Street parking is competitive; we rented space in one of many nearby garages. Nice sitting area at front of building, shrub-lined with gate for privacy. This section of Underhill Avenue seems very quiet, with low pedestrian traffic (and almost everyone wears a mask). Apartment is quite large by Brooklyn standards, and window-filled for lots of light. It has an open living-dining-kitchen area, wood floors with area rugs (NO SHOES policy), huge master with en suite full bathroom, 2nd full bathroom off hallway, large 2nd bedroom and 2 smaller bedrooms which could also be used as office space. Each bedroom has a "reach-in" closet for storage. Kitchen has good cabinet space, 4-burner gas stove/oven, full frig, dishwasher, and many nice cooking/dining supplies. Kitchen and both baths have lots of granite (latter with tub/shower combos). No washer/dryer (for our longer stay, Dimitri provided clean linens+towels every 2 weeks). Nice TV with DVD; has usual "goosey" DISH-TV (think host may change this soon). Great WIFI coverage and central heating. Every apartment has a door-buzzer system, so all deliveries can be left in 1st floor entry hall to allow NO CONTACT access. Everyone onsite follows Dr Fauci's advice-- wearing masks, social distancing and minimizing contact to protect each other. Dimitri's  apartment made it possible for us  senior citizens to feel safe and snug amidst resurging pestilence, a fall heat wave, 2 snow storms and that ever-present "COVID cabin fever". We definitely would recommend this apartment to our family and friends!

The space is grr generally musty and dusty. AC is limited to the bedroom and washer/dryer wasn’t operating during our weeklong stay. Internet speed made video calls impossible, so would come prepared if you’re planning on working remotely.
Amazing space, in a perfectly quaint location in Greenpoint. The space is gorgeous. Best shower in all of NY! Highly recommend. Definitely worth it!!

Maya’s place is a Greenpoint gem! It is close to fun bars and restaurants on Franklin Ave and it’s a special experience staying in a historic townhouse. Maya was incredibly responsive to us throughout our stay and made sure we were comfortable. The bed was very comfortable and the bathtub is a wonder!!
outstanding place. I felt like I was home. Maya is great! I'll be back.

Beautiful location and home! We stayed here for a week and we loved it. Maya was a wonderful host. She was very quick to respond to our questions. Unfortunately, the washer and dryer was broken that week.

We enjoyed our stay! Maya has a wonderful style and her home reflects that. The location in Greenpoint is unbeatable. You are close to everything and still tucked away down a quaint, quiet street. Maya responds to queries right away. Please pay attention to the house description as it is not appropriate for young children or people with mobility issues. There are no stair railings inside the home and you must use stairs to get to living areas. If you are a lover of esthetics with fun and funky style, then this is the place for you.
Had a great stay here. Close to Staten Island ferry which gets you to Manhattan for free and offers a nice view of the skyline and Statue of Liberty.
Comfortable stay, great location & even better host. Highly recommend!
Great place! Very comfy
Super cool Hosts / great value and location / excellent attention to detail!!! I look forward to visiting again!
A very affordable nice stay. host was very kind with fast responds
I would stay here again, I was happy with the accommodations.
The place is quiet and pleasant. You have a clean bathroom and a clean cafe/kitchen at your disposal.
Small room, not worth the price paid. They were doing upgrades as I was leaving, so it'll probably improve in the future.
Great place convenient and great price
Cozy & Comfortable

My stay at Vie's place was both enjoyable and pleasant. Not only was her location within 3 blocks of the train station to Manhattan and the rest of NYC, but she provided local tips, free coffee, comfortable bed, quick response to questions and even a discount due to booking her place during the Covid-19 pandemic so that I could visit family /friends while having my own privacy. I highly recommend that if you're visiting anywhere in NYC including lower Westchester that you stay with Violet aka Vie for her great hospitality.

Difficult to see beyond New York being the world's greatest city and apartment provides a good base from which to explore it. Not that close to Midtown but 10 mins takes you to the subway. Nice pubs and restaurants within a very short walk. Apartment itself could do with updating and a good clean. Stairs not suitable for younger kids or anyone with mobility issues.

Book this spot if available! My boyfriend and I so enjoyed the hospitality and welcoming atmosphere that Niya created. First of all, this space is incredible. A Brooklyn brownstone in lovingly restored condition and the most incredible art and literature gracing the entire space make this place a knock-out. And the space is well-laid out for an enjoyable stay. Plus the neighborhood is great! So many awesome spots for all types of food. Also, the distance from the A-train is a huge plus to get to Manhattan quickly. A big thanks to Niya for the many reqs in the neighborhood! He was so kind when he greeted us with a tour of the space and amenities (including all of our questions about the amazing art), neighborhood recommendations,  as well as some New York tips for our stay and travels. 

We also enjoyed the details that Niya put into the space to be accommodating. Coming and going was a breeze, and with lots of good luck with the statue by the door. Niya also outfitted the space with a mini-fridge, electric kettle, microwave, and some utensils/dishes in case you need them. Ohh and I was worried about being cold because I'm a wimp in the cold, but the place was always comfortable and had extra blankets if needed. 

Again, we had such a great visit in this space and highly recommend it! And when you get here, take in the glory that is the bathroom 2-story gallery wall. It's incredible like all the other pieces throughout the space. Enjoy!

Lovely place to stay in NYC. Great location, cossy and welcoming apartmet with amazing diamod inside - the Host Herself. Debbie is most welcoming and possitive person that we met during our travels. It was a great stay in NYC. 100% we will come back and stay at Debbie place.

Super Zen,
I felt like I was in my own private yoga studio while I stayed here.
Very comfortable and relaxing, also close to food and subways.

I highly reccomend!

Edward's apartment is very well located. The price is very good for New York City and the room is comfortable. One thing to be noted is that during our stay the pipes made some noise at night.
We stayed there a week and could easily get to all the parts in New York we wanted to visit. 
We did not get to meet Edward but communication with him through the AirBnB messages was good.
Not much to say here :-) excellent flat, great hospitality and communication, every single little thing was on point. Just book it already.
Great place. I stayed there over a month and felt very comfortable. Valerie was also a great host.
Valerie’s home is conveniently located and very spacious for New York. It’s a perfect spot for a person or couple.

The apartment is cute and cozy; the bed is super comfy, and the space was clean.  We loved the location!  Close to several subway lines so it's easy to get to Manhattan for day trips, and there are so many cute bars and restaurants all within easy walking distance.  A great Brooklyn getaway!

This place has the potential to be a great airbnb experience, so I will just make some observations for the host to take in consideration. I had a defective key for the building main entrance and had to wait for other people to open the door for me and was provided a key not exactly immediatly. After that, I can say the place isn’t exactly as the photos, it’s windows doesn’t have blinds or curtains as shown excepting the bedroom which makes the experience a little weird, and there is no tv as shown in photos although the description does say it doesn’t.
Besides this, everything else was okay.

Had a great stay at Larissa's place. The location is brilliant with loads of great local spots to eat and drink, plus it's a breeze to either take the nearby subway or walk over the Williamsburg bridge into the city. 

The apartment was exactly as advertised. It was clean, comfortable and check in and out was super easy via a lock box and Larissa was quick to respond and easy to communicate with. Highly recommended and great value given the location.

Larissas place was very conveniently located to some great parts of Brooklyn as well as the subway. She was very helpful in answering all my questions before and during my stay. The location has great natural light and is perfect for a short trip while having the essentials you need

Our stay in larissa’s place was great - the apartment was very clean and is in a great location nearby subways, restaurants and stores within walking distance. Our only issue that we had occurred the day of our stay as we were told we had to pay an extra $20 a night after the first guest. Admittedly I happened to miss this detail clearly written in the additional prices area but I’ve never experienced this pricing for an Airbnb so it threw me off to receive a message day of check in that I owe an extra $70 after I already paid the reservation in full a month beforehand. It wasn’t a make or break deal, however, cause we were already en route to the city and the nightly rate was cheap and in a good location but she mentioned that this happens all the time so be sure to double check this factor when determining the pricing and comparing other apartments! Otherwise we had a great stay

Larissa was very nice and super quick to answer any question or call. Her appartement is really well located in Williamsburg, close to shops and restaurants, and a short walk to quirky cool Greenpoint as well. The View on the Brooklyn roofs is nice and we could even see some of the Chrysler Building! We enjoyed staying there a lot. There’s a bodega so very convenient if you have forgotten to buy coffee! Many thanks Larissa :)

The best. Larissa is personable, helpful, patient, friendly, and communicative. 10/10 person and host. She has made my stay far easier and more pleasant and stress-free than I could have hoped for: The space is homey, spacious, full of character, comfortable, and private but it an excellent location. 10/10

Melissa’s apartment was immaculately clean and comfortable. Carroll Street stop is only minutes away, with a variety of excellent restaurants, wine shops, bars and coffee bars.
Because it was reveillon holiday, we did not met Melissa but the communication was ease.
The kitchen is the other great point. We had everything we need. Super organized.
As it is a 10 minute walk from our daughter's house, we will definitely be back soon. Thank you so much Melissa
Perfect accommodations for a few days in NYC. Melissa was super responsive to all of our questions and the space was clean, comfortable and in a fantastic location.

The location of this apartment in a lovely area of Brooklyn was great!  Beautiful and quiet tree-lined street.  Very close to the Subway, which made it easy to get in and out of the city.  Great neighborhood with lots of cute shops and good restaurants nearby.  Nice little apartment perfect for 2 people or 2 people and a little one.

Top notch place to stay in the heart of Brooklyn.    Extremely clean , safe and quiet.   A true home away from home  that my hubby and I highly recommend to anyone visiting the area.   Melissa is truly a super host attentive to our every need.   Will definitely be returning.

It was the best of times, it was the worst of times.  I arrived at Melissa's adorable garden apartment just 7 days before NYC was declared a coronavirus hotspot.  I was scheduled to stay at her place for a month while working on a dream job... and then my job was cancelled.  Melissa was very cooperative in dealing with Airbnb and making sure that we could cancel the reservation and that I could see a refund for the unused time.  I am very grateful.  The apartment has everything you need for a longer stay and is situated in the fantastic neighborhood of Carroll Gardens.  I wished I could have stayed longer!!!!  Best wishes and a million thanks to Melissa and her family.

Samir's place was amazing. Beautiful loft, great decoration, super spacious. Very central location. 
The keys are at a Cafe 3 blocks away which was very convenient since I got there in the middle of the night. 
Very responsive host. 
Overall great experience, would recommend and stay again if I go back.
Lovely space in an excellent location! A comfy bed and a well-stocked kitchen made my stay extra nice. I will book again whenever I can!

Samir has a great spot in the east village.    Super cool space and the piano was clutch.   The bar downstairs can get a little loud on the weekends but its the east village so kind of goes with the territory.   Would stay again.   Thanks Samir!

Samir’s place is perfectly located, super stylish and a music lovers paradise! I really enjoyed my 5 nights stay, there was plenty of local pubs and restaurants and was still within walking distance to the big Manhattan landmarks. Would love to stay again.
This was my second stay at Samir's place - so that alone is a testament. I found it so lovely the first time, I came back!
Nice decor, a very interesting and well decorated apartment.
Amazing decoration, great location and a good valur for money! The house was clean overall but not up to the high standards. If you are looking for a sparkling clean, try somewhere else
Great place right in the East Village. Close to everything. Bigger than it looks from the photos, and a really nice interior. Would recommend.

My stay at Samir's apartment was great. The photos match quite well, and besides some issues with the kitchen, it was a beautiful place to stay for a week. Location is great, decor was great, and I'd recommend it!

Absolutely great location. Very nice space, well-appointed. Very comfortable bed. As noted, there’s some noise from outdoor bar below. We didn’t mind at all, but you will hear some festive talking, through closed windows in kitchen and bathroom. 
A bit disappointed that the patio was not usable from our perspective, with the boisterous crowd right there, and heavy smell from McDonald’s. But this was still an awesome place to stay, right in the heart of the east village, with a great kitchen/private laundry/comfortable sleeping location, and astoundingly quiet sleeping with great sealed windows even though right on very busy 1st ave. Highly recommended. And of course, that gorgeous piano that sadly only reminded me how much I’ve forgotten in 20 years since playing.

Samir's apartment is incredibly spacious for New York City, and in one of the best locations you could ask for with easy access to restaurants, bars, grocery stores, pharmacy, parks, and public transportation. We stayed here for 3 weeks, and it was a great spot from which we could explore the city. Samir was also very responsive and check-in was really simple, which is not always the case in NYC. The description also mentions street noise, but we didn't hear any of that in the apartment, which made sleeping that much easier.

We did have a few issues though. The bed is soft, which at first was great, but after a little while made our backs ache. There also wasn't much room to hang up our clothes, which is ok once again for a short stay, but for a longer stay made things more inconvenient. There were also some cleaning issues, some of which we resolved ourselves, and others which Samir helped us with, but would have loved to have not been an issue to begin with.

All in all, Samir's place is a great spot from which to explore NYC without having to compromise on space.
A beautiful stay in a great location!

The key pick-up and drop-off point is a short walk away, so dealing with this process is OK in itself, but a bit inconvenient with Luggage (I had 2 large trunks on wheels. I'd prefer an electric lock or something more modern. 
The place itself is perfect, please keep it clean and thank you to Samir.
10/10!! Loved staying here. Thanks Samir.

This place is sexy. Comfortable. So much bigger than it seems in the pictures. Amazing  patio. The location is incredible. Samir responds immediately and was incredibly accommodating. The bar below has the friendliest bartenders around. The piano is stunning and kept in tune and sounds  incredible. No complaints. Absolutely loved my stay.

This is a HUGE studio by NYC standards.  The apartment has a great, stylish vibe and the location is perfect.  The East Village is a fun place to be and the apartment is a short walk to the subway.    If you get a chance I suggest you try out Monomono just steps aways on 4th street for some Korean\Asian Fusion dishes.  Please note that the apartment is above a bar on 1st Ave.  It was not noisy but we were here during Covid's 11:00PM curfew.

Samir’s place is great! The pictures do not do justice in my opinion. Great use of space with stylish touches. The location is also perfect and in the heart of east village, close to Washington square park as well. Overall, we had a very nice experience at Samir’s place.

Tony was very responsive. The location was perfect along Bowery with walking distance from Little Italy and Chinatown. Tony offered excellent suggestions in the Lower East Side. Very clean space and welcoming.

Had to check in much later than expected, but Tony was super accommodating. Space was very clean and surprisingly quiet for NYC. He gave us lots of food recommendations and it felt more like staying with a friend vs a paid service. 

(FYI, his girlfriend also lives there but she is equally friendly, polite, and quiet!)

By far one of the best hosts I’ve encountered on Airbnb! Tony is incredibly friendly and hospitable. He goes above and beyond to be welcoming, without ever coming across as intrusive. Communication with him was always speedy and consistent and he went through great lengths to make our visit a breeze. I 100% recommend Tony’s apartment due to his thoughtful and attentive nature as well as the terrific proximity to  major attractions.  At Tony’s we felt like we were staying with a good friend!

From the beginning, Tony was a great host and very communicative. Check in was a breeze even though I arrived early. The location is excellent, especially if you spend a lot of time in Chinatown, Soho, LES and East Village. Grand station is a 30 second walk from the apartment and many restaurants and cafes and a short walk away. The apartment was clean and pretty quiet. Will definitely stay here again.

I would 110% recommend staying here. Not only is Tony a great host with lots of local tips but it’s an amazing location (not even a 1 min walk to the closest subway), was always clean and Tony is always looking out for you and making sure you feel at home even when you are so far away from it! I had a great time and if I ever return to nyc I’d definitely be staying here again. Thanks for letting me stay in your beautiful home Tony and being so accomodating! :)
Everything was perfect! Great location and space- and Tony is an excellent host
unbeatable location and great host! definitely recommend!
Tony makes the stay an effortless experience from check in to check out. Super friendly and great recommendations for great food and drinks!
Great place! Would rent again in a heart beat. Tony is a great host
Very clean, spacious, nice apartment. Great location: across the street from a great park. Lots of food options in the area. 1 minute from the subway.
Woah! Tony really is a super host! He was super responsive, recommended yummy places and his home really feels like your home. Hands down would stay here again anytime!

great spot
great location
great tips
great host

overall amazing.

Tony is the most perfect host. He made sure every single aspect of the stay was flawless. His home is beautiful, spacious, and spotlessly clean. His beautiful paintings made the space feel even more serene and relaxing. I very highly recommend staying at Tony's home. Thank you so much Tony, all your kindness is so appreciated, as is your incredible home."
Super host, cozy room and good location. Tony is really kind and responsive before and during stay. Highly recommended.
Good location. Easy to find street parking.

Loved staying at this apartment. It's central, quiet inside, spacious and well thought out in terms of layout. Not to mention the big dining table perfect for working and eating! And, of course, Tony was a fantastic host - quick and friendly communication, super accommodating; had no issues whatsoever and would stay here again!

Tony is an attentive, flexible, and accommodating host. The apartment is large, and has good Wifi, TV, and kitchen appliances. We worked remotely from the apartment for 2 weeks, and it met all of our needs!

Tony is amazing !! Had just a couple of unexpected issues & Tony was on it immediately ! He was so attentive. Communication was A+. Apartment is very simple yet adorable ! Bed was so comfortable & bedding was so soft. The extra mattress on the floor in guest room is a real mattress, not an air mattress which was a plus. Enough room at dining table for guest. Plenty of places to eat near by. 2 train stations very close by as well. Windows open easily if you need cooled down. Less than expected street noise for NYC. The little noises we heard were easily drowned out with our sound machine at night time. Would definitely recommend Tony’s place. We would stay with him again if staying in that area. He is also great to recommend places to eat & things to do.

Tony could not be a more hospitable host. He is very responsive and communicates quickly. All of the positive reviews you read about him are true! 

The apartment is in a great location, easily accessible to Chinatown, LES, East village and Nolita. It was super easy to check in and walk to new locations each day. 

My friend and I needed a place where we could work from home and the Internet was super fast. We could both take video calls simultaneously without any problems

Overall, it was a nice space in a good neighborhood, but Tony really went above and beyond to make sure we were comfortable and taken care of.

This was an incredible trip. Tony is an amazing host ... communicates above and beyond what you'd ever expect, gives great recommendations, and hosts a wonderful and QUIET apartment. There's everything you need in this place, including lots of room. But again, can't stress how quiet the place is! The place is in a great spot - walking around downtown is a breeze. It was a pleasure to stay here and we look forward to returning soon.
Great place to stay and what a cool scene to eat, bike and explore.
You’ll have a great base from which to  explore the city with a host who cares that you have a great experience.

If you are looking for a cozy and private and a place where you do not have to worry that someone will come and knock because want to clean, then this is the one. if you are looking for a place where you would like to cook for yourself then this is the one. we loved everything about this place.  it is very clean and comfortable,  we had our 8 years old with us by no mean she was homesick. This says everything doesn't? It is very well located and mostly is soooo close to the tube station or subway and not mention the variety of restaurants. Eva

Great location! Would recommend for a group of friends looking to visit New York. The appartement was very well located close to a subway station. 
Thank you Henning!
Great space. Excellent location for city college and Columbia

Henning's place is impeccably located, quite large, well equipped and very reasonably priced. It is ideal for long stays, being within walking distance to supermarkets, laundromats, more food places than I can count etc. Bad timing, however, was a factor that I had some difficulties during my first couple of weeks in the house.  Damage was done to the apartment from a previous tenant and Henning was away, unable to replace the damaged amenities, hence the bad timing. This resulted in some amenities missing, including a desk chair, which brought some inconvenience since I spend quite a lot of time on my computer. This was not enough to spoil my stay there, however, or my willingness to return to Henning's house should I require such a space again. Despite my briefly inconvenient experience, I would definitely recommend this place to future travelers.
Great location, small apartment but very comfortable and clean. Henning was a great host and accommodated our check out changes. We loved our stay and will definitely stay again when back in NYC!
This place was great for a long term rental for several months. Communication was excellent—fast and responsive. Place is a bit quirky in a charming way, and location was very convenient.
Great place, close to subway. Recommend!
Perfect location in Park Slope. Great neighborhood. Convenient to stores, restaurants, Metro. Lots of room to spread out but no door on the bedroom. Well stocked kitchenware. Would stay again.

Great location, very clean, good supply of kitchen items. Spacious apartment. We had a toddler with us and the layout worked well to put the toddler in the front of the apartment and then we slept in the bedroom. Bed is not very comfortable and the pillows are very uncomfortable. There is a pack n play in the closet, we brought ours because we didn't know so we didn't use it but hope that will save someone else in the future.

Our group really liked Stefano's place. He is a great host, very responsive and understanding, he helped us a lot. The apartment is clean and close to a lot of restaurant, one of them is mg favourite bbq place in New York. We're incredibly sorry to leave sooner than expected but we'll definitely go back. 
Highly recommended.
This apartment was delightful. Roomy, clean, cozy. It had everything we needed and made for a very enjoyable stay
This is my second stay at Jana's place.  As before, a perfect sanctuary in a very cool part of Brooklyn.
Amazing stay during these times glad I was able to be so close to work ! Thanks for the great stay !
Jana’s place is amazingly clean, in a safe location, and has the best attractions nearby. She is an amazing host and was willing to go far and beyond to make my stay comfortable.
An ideal to stay in Brooklyn if you're planning a trip. The inside of the place itself, the location, and the hosts were all great! I would highly recommend.

The stay was fantastic. It's a great space, well-described, and close to markets, restaurants, coffee shops, etc. Hosts were incredibly responsive and helpful, lots of great tips on the neighborhood. Stay was for 2 weeks with easy and flexible check-in/out process. Will be recommending it to friends without hesitation.

Beautiful apartment--VERY spacious, spotlessly clean, nicely decorated with everything needed, very private. Having garden access was especially nice in the summer, and the neighborhood is great. The discount for a week-long rental made the price quite reasonable for the space. Highly recommended for anyone visiting New York.

We loved our short staycation at Jana’s lovely place. It was exactly what we needed to refresh our routine, after spending months like many others in our cramped Manhattan apartment. Our daughter enjoyed toddling around in the backyard, and Jana was kind enough to provide many tools to help ward off the mosquitos. The neighborhood is walkable and we enjoyed the surroundings despite heat! Highly recommend staying with Jana if you’re interested in exploring Brooklyn and having a comfortable home base.
Very nice modern and sophisticated space and convenient location, we enjoyed our stay! Thanks so much!

Jana’s place is cozy, clean, perfectly located in an awesome area of Brooklyn. Add to that a wonderful outdoor space it really is a hidden gem!!! There is easy access to street parking and public transport. It’s a perfect place for a short trip or an extended stay. Jana is a very thoughtful host and her pro tip on how to deal with the mosquitoes really allowed us to make the most of the cute backyard.

Great, clean, open space with a delightful backyard. Came back after a long sojourn to stay in the city, and knew this was the neighborhood to be in. The perfect place to both work and relax during the day and journey out to both Brooklyn and Manhattan. Would absolutely stay again.
Perfect location, comfortable cool space in a wonderful BK neighborhood. Private garden is a delight. An unexpected urban  respite. Jana is beyond a super host.
This place is top notch. Highly recommended! Perhaps the best place I’ve ever stayed.

Jana's lovely apartment was the perfect abode for my mother when she visited Brooklyn for two weeks to help me with my newborn. Jana was communicative leading up to the visit and helpful throughout her stay if my mother had any questions. It's a clean, cozy, welcoming space and the perfect spot to call "home" for a few days or weeks. Thank you, Jana! My mom will be back :)

Great location in Brooklyn. The apartment is on a very quiet block, but the two main streets in the area, Smith and Court, are only 2 or 3 blocks away with a lot to do. The yard is very big and a nice place to chill if you just want to stay home for the day.

Beautiful and comfortable apartment in a perfect location for all that Brooklyn has to offer.  All went smoothly from check in to check out, very clean, comfortable bed, perfect for us.  Thank you Jana for making our stay so lovely.
Jana's ground-floor apartment is the perfect place for a week-long work trip: It is private, quiet,  has full amenities, and very clean. We will certainly be back again!

Jana’s place was very clean with lovely furniture. She provided coffee for our mornings which was great. Jana responded quickly to any question before our visit, which I appreciated. I will always try to rent Jana’s every time we visit.

Great location, close to restaurants and shops on Court and Smith. Nicely maintained apt with full amenities and ample space for two. Comfortable bed and good shower. Nice owners who respond promptly. Highly recommended.
Clean, very nice amenities, and great location. Jana was an excellent host!

Jana's place was spotless and had everything you would need for a stay--from toaster and coffee maker to washer dryer and reliable internet and a sweet outdoor space (though it was too cold to use while I was there).  Highly recommend for anyone who wants a cozy space for a stay in Brooklyn!
Jana’s place is wonderful! I recommend anyone who wants a stay in Brooklyn to visit this clean, cute, and well-located spot!

Jana’s place was a perfect stay. Jana was super responsive and accommodating, and the apartment is clean, comfortable and cozy. Comfy bed! And of course the Carroll Gardens location is great. Thanks Jana for a great stay!
Great place!
Jana is very helpful. Clean, quiet and lovely place to stay .

Jana's place is perfect for a weekend getaway or a longer stay. It feels like your own apartment. The location is hard to beat! She's so close to Court, Smith, and Union! Amazing food and shops abound. The place was sparkling clean and we had everything we needed.

I stayed as a local staycation birthday getaway and loved it. Very homey and perfect for a single person looking for peace and quiet. The patio is *everything* and I absolutely loved drawing a relaxing epsom salt and lavender bath in the comfy tub!

It was truly a lovely stay, with SO MANY delicious food options on Seamless!

A well appointed kitchen and bathroom.  In summer there appears to be a nice backyard.  There was snow on the ground when we were there so obviously didn't venture outside.  The floor plan of the unit is well designed and the space is quite comfortable.

Our stay at Jana's was great! The space is exactly as shown in the photographs- sparkling clean, beautifully designed, with every comfort we could desire over the course of our stay. Jana was an incredibly thoughtful and accommodating host, and she answered all of our questions immediately. We'd gladly stay there again.

Jana’s place has everything that a traveler could possibly need. Her apartment is sparkling clean and I mean sparkling.  The bedding was also so very comfortable. The neighborhood is cute and feels very safe. 

Jana responded to all inquiries very quickly. She was very easy to work with. 

My son and his family live a few minutes away from Jana’s Airbnb. This was my first visit to Jana’s place but it most definitely won’t be my last. It is now my home away from home. 

Thank you Jana for being an awesome host!
